news.title: Trump’s $100,000 H-1B fee sparks a global race to grab top talent
news.summary: The six-figure H-1B visa fee has jolted companies that have long relied on the program to bring in top global talent.

news.title: Trump administration reportedly plans to link autism to Tylenol use during pregnancy
news.summary: Federal health officials also are expected to highlight leucovorin as a potential autism treatment, according to The Washington Post. The drug has been linked to a number of autism-related illnesses.

news.title: Oracle names Clay Magouyrk and Mike Sicilia as co-CEOs
news.summary: Oracle is promoting its presidents of cloud infrastructure, Clay Magouyrk, and industries, Mike Sicilia, to co-CEOs.

news.title: Pfizer boosts obesity drug prospects with $7.3 billion deal to buy Metsera
news.summary: Metsera, founded in 2022, brings a pipeline of both oral and injectable treatments with different targets that could boost Pfizer's odds of entering the market.

news.title: Saudi defense pact with Pakistan unlikely to disrupt oil flows to India, source says
news.summary: India is one of the world's largest crude consumers and a key customer for Saudi Arabia. India has been in conflict with neighboring Pakistan for decades.

news.title: Oracle is getting two new CEOs. What does that mean for the stock?
news.summary: Safra Catz will stay involved at Oracle in the role of executive vice chair. Investors can expect a smooth transition as Clay Magouyrk and Mike Sicilia jointly assume the CEO position.

news.title: Brain drain? How Wall Street is reacting to $100,000 charge for H-1B visas
news.summary: New rules will require a $100,000 fee for a type of visa used extensively in the technology industry. Fears of an exodus of talent that will sap the potential for growth.

news.title: Pfizer makes a $4.9 billion bet on obesity drugs with Metsera buyout deal
news.summary: Metsera’s shareholders could see significant bonuses if certain milestones are reached. Metsera could be worth as much as $1 billion if it reaches certain milestones.

news.title: You’re just getting scraps from the stock market. Here’s where the big money is made.
news.summary: When it comes to growth investing, it’s a small club — and you’re not in it. You can’t be in the growth investing club if you don't invest in growth.

news.title: ‘I want to live in a place that I can enjoy’: I’m 69, single and get $3,000 in Social Security. Can I afford $2,000 rent?
news.summary: “With inheritance, I now have a little over $1 million in cash and investments,” he says. “I’m in a good place.”
